headline: What Dover (DOV)'s 2026 Guidance and Billion-Dollar Buyback Mean For Shareholders
summary: In late January 2026, Dover Corporation reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing sales rising to US$2,099.08 million and issued 2026 guidance calling for GAAP EPS of US$8.95–US$9.15 on 5%–7% revenue growth. Alongside these results, Dover completed a US$1.04 billion share repurchase program, retiring 5,403,292 shares, which reflects management’s confidence in the company’s cash generation and longer-term earnings power. Next, we’ll examine how Dover’s 2026 earnings guidance, underpinned...

headline: A Look At Dover (DOV) Valuation After Earnings Beat And 2026 Guidance
summary: Dover (DOV) is back in focus after reporting fourth quarter 2025 results that topped Wall Street revenue expectations, and pairing that with 2026 guidance that points to moderate growth and a cautious tone on costs. See our latest analysis for Dover. The latest update has drawn fresh attention to the share price, which closed at US$207.32 after a 1 day share price return of 2.9%, adding to a 90 day share price return of 16.3% and a 5 year total shareholder return of 82.9%. This suggests...

headline: Does Dover Corp. (DOV) Have a Long Runway for Growth?
summary: Diamond Hill Capital, an investment management company, released its “Large Cap Fund” fourth-quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here.
